result.execSummary:
The defendant Deyon Jermaine Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including the DNA surcharge by 08-11-17. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Count 2 and Concurrent to any other sentence
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION; credit for 55 days served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deyon Jermaine Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2, and concurrent to any other sentence.

AS TO COUNT 2
Court ordered defendant to serve 55 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 55 DAYS time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, to be paid by 8/11/2017. Bail on deposit to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Filed, 
Notice to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Deyon Jermaine Lee in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Deyon Jermaine Lee in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Criminal Damage to Property, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.01(1) and 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1) and 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Deyon Jermaine Lee not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-11-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, Defendant Deyon Jermaine Lee not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jessica H

Defendant Deyon Jermaine Lee in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Deyon Jermaine Lee in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
